inv.description: Invite me to a server, or join my support server.

permissions.description: Check your permissions, and my permissions.
permissions.compact: Note for mobile users: you can add the argument "--compact" (ex `{0}perms {1} --compact{2}`) for less text, allthough it may be harder to understand.
permissions.channel: To see channel specific permissions, add the arguent "--channel" (ex `{0}perms {1} --channel{2}`)

shards.description: Get some information about my shards.
shards.title: Shard Information
shards.devOnly: You must be a developer to use this commands subcommands.

sinfo.description: Get some info about the current server.
sinfo.sectionDesc: The section to get info on

verification.lowDesc: must have verified email on account
verification.mediumDesc: must be registered on Discord for longer than 5 minutes
verification.highDesc: (╯°□°）╯︵ ┻━┻ - must be a member of the server for longer than 10 minutes
verification.veryHighDesc: ┻━┻ミヽ(ಠ益ಠ)ﾉ彡┻━┻ - must have a verified phone number

sinfo.title: Server Info
sinfo.noteContent: Status counts are based on cached users, and may not include all server members
sinfo.helpNotice: You can provide `help` to see the other possible sections. (e.g. `{0}sinfo help`)
sinfo.noBanner: This server does not have a banner.
sinfo.noSplash: This server does not have an invite splash.

stats.sectionDesc: The subsection to get stats for.
stats.cmdFull: Use `{0}stats commands` for full command stats.
stats.devOnly: This section is for developers only.
stats.interval: All per second stats are calculated over a 15 second period.

uinfo.description: Get some info about a user.
uinfo.userDesc: The user to get info about.
uinfo.title: User Info
uinfo.tooManyRoles: Too many roles to list, please use `{0}roles {1}` to list them.
uinfo.statusNote: Note: Since Discord hasn't given us the `presence` intent, we cannot get proper status/game information.

whoplays.description: Get a list of users playing the specified game.
whoplays.gameDesc: The game string to search for.
whoplays.title: Who Is Playing: {0}
whoplays.limit: There are too many people playing this game to display them separately.
whoplays.globalNote: You can add `--global` after the game to search globally.
